description:
APM dashboard for monitoring OpenTelemetry-based services.  

Instrument your applications using OpenTelemetry SDKs and send traces, metrics, and logs to Tempo for traces, a Prometheus-compatible database like Mimir for metrics, and Loki for logs. This dashboard provides a centralized view of your application's health and performance.  

For a fully managed observability stack, consider using Grafana Cloud.  

Learn more about this dashboard on https://github.com/cyrille-leclerc/opentelemetry-service-dashboard.

options.content: Service: ${service_namespace}/${service_name} env: ${deployment_environment_name}

panels.description: Shows the timestamp of the latest metrics received in the past 24h.

targets.expr: timestamp(sum by (deployment_environment_name, service_namespace, exported_job) (target_info{deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}) or absent{})

panels.title: Latest metrics received

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(le, namespace, exported_job) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_bucket{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])))
histogram_quantile(0.9, sum by(le, namespace, exported_job) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_bucket{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])))

avg by(namespace, exported_job) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_sum{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])) / avg by(namespace, exported_job) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Server Response Time

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr: (sum(rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval])) by (namespace, exported_job))

panels.title: Server Requests (rate)

panels.description:
HTTP endpoints aggregation on the `http.server.request.duration` metric. 

Errors are identified by   `http.response.status_code=~"5.."`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr: (sum by(namespace, exported_job) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval])) * 100) / sum by(namespace, exported_job) (rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Failed Requests

panels.description:
Inbound HTTP operations of the service (aka HTTP endpoints) based on the `http.server.request.duration` metric.

Errors are identified by `http.response.status_code=~"5.."`.

See https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/semconv/http/http-metrics/#metric-httpserverrequestduration

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(
  sum by (operation) (
    label_join(
      rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
      "operation",
      " ",
      "http_request_method",
      "http_route"
    )
  )[5m:]
)

(
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (operation) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
            )
        )
    )

histogram_quantile(
            0.99,
            sum by (le, operation) (
                label_join(
                rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_bucket{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[5m]),
                "operation",
                " ",
                "http_request_method",
                "http_route"
                )
            )
        )

panels.title: HTTP Operations

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(
sum by (outbound_service) (
    label_join(
        rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
        "outbound_service",
        " ",
        "server_address",
        "http_request_method",
        "url_template"
    )
  )[5m:]
)

(
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name", http_response_status_code=~"5.."}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
     / 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
    ) or (0 * 
        sum by (outbound_service) (
            label_join(
                rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_count{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[$__rate_interval]),
                "outbound_service",
                " ",
                "server_address",
                "http_request_method",
                "url_template"
            )
        )
    )

histogram_quantile(
    0.99,
    sum by (le, outbound_service) (
        label_join(
        rate(http_client_request_duration_seconds_bucket{namespace=~"$service_namespace", exported_job=~"$service_name"}[5m]),
        "outbound_service",
        " ",
        "server_address",
        "http_request_method",
        "url_template"
        )
    )
)

sum(rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{
  exported_job=~"$service_name", 
  http_request_method=~".*", 
  http_route=~".*", 
  http_route!="/healthz", 
  http_route!=""
}[5m])) by (exported_job, http_request_method, http_route) * $__interval_ms / 1000

sum(rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{
  exported_job=~"$service_name", 
  http_request_method=~".*", 
  http_response_status_code=~"2..", 
  http_route=~".*", 
  http_route!="/healthz", 
  http_route!=""
}[5m])) by (exported_job, http_request_method, http_route) * $__interval_ms / 1000

sum(rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{
  exported_job=~"$service_name", 
  http_request_method=~".*", 
  http_response_status_code=~"3..", 
  http_route=~".*", 
  http_route!~"/healthz|^$"
}[5m])) by (exported_job, http_request_method, http_route) * $__interval_ms / 1000

sum(rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{
  exported_job=~"$service_name", 
  http_request_method=~".*", 
  http_response_status_code=~"4..", 
  http_route=~".*", 
  http_route!~"/healthz|^$"
}[5m])) by (exported_job, http_request_method, http_route) * $__interval_ms / 1000

sum(rate(http_server_request_duration_seconds_count{
  exported_job=~"$service_name", 
  http_request_method=~".*", 
  http_response_status_code=~"5..", 
  http_route=~".*", 
  http_route!~"/healthz|^$"
}[5m])) by (exported_job, http_request_method, http_route) * $__interval_ms / 1000

panels.description: Traces containing a span emitted by the service

targets.query: {resource.service.name="$service_name" && resource.k8s.namespace.name="$service_namespace" && span.http.response.status_code!=202 && span.http.response.status_code!=204 && span.http.response.status_code!=200} | select(span.url.path, span.server.address, span.http.response.status_code)

panels.description:
Logs of the service, filtered by `service.name` and `service.namespace`.

To explore the logs, open the menu clicking on the icon `` of this panel and click on `Explore`.

targets.expr: {deployment_environment_name=~"$deployment_environment_name", service_namespace=~"$service_namespace", service_name="$service_name"} | line_format `[1m{{if .level }}{{alignRight 5 .level}}{{else if .severity_text}}{{alignRight 5 .severity_text}}{{end}}[0m [90m[{{alignRight 10 .service_instance_id}}{{if .thread_name}}/{{alignRight 20 .thread_name}}{{else if eq "java" .telemetry_sdk_language }}                    {{end}}][0m [36m{{if .scope_name }}{{alignRight 40 .scope_name}}{{end}}{{if .exception_type}} [1;101m [0m{{end}} {{if .exception_type}}[1;91m{{.exception_type}}[0m{{end}}{{if .exception_message}} [1;91m{{.exception_message}}[0m {{end}} [0m {{__line__}} {{if .trace_id}} [37m[3m[trace_id={{.trace_id}}]{{end}}`

list.description:
OpenTelemetry metrics. 
Send metrics using the Prometheus OTLP endpoint activating `keep_identifying_resource_attributes` and resource attribute promotion (aka `promote_resource_attributes`) including `service.name`, service.namespace`, `service.instance.id`, and `deployment.environment.name`
list.label: Metrics
list.name: prometheus_datasource

list.description:
OpenTelemetry logs.

Send logs using the Loki OTLP endpoint activating resource attribute promotion (aka `default_resource_attributes_as_index_labels`) including `service.name`, service.namespace`, and `deployment.environment.name`
list.label: Logs
list.name: loki_datasource

title: APM for OpenTelemetry
